brewery.brewery_description:
BrewFist nasce nel 2010 dalla passione per la birra.
Il progetto si basa sul produrre birre originali, di grande bevibilità e qualità. BrewFist è sempre alla ricerca di nuovi ingredienti, nuove tecniche e nuove idee...

BrewFist was founded in 2010 by a passion for beer. The project is based on producing real ales, with great drinkability and quality. 

BrewFist is always looking for new ingredients, new techniques and new ideas...

beer.beer_description: Gose with bergamot peel. Collaboration brew with DeMolen brewery

user.bio: Into beer & food pairing. IPA lover.
Caña aquí! Dale, una chela! beer here!

items.badge_description: First brewed in the early 16th century, this peculiar flavored beer has made quite the come back. With a tart, salty combination, your taste buds are probably still tingling... and excited for more! That's 20 different beers with the style of Gose. Try 5 more for Level 5!

user.bio: My body is a temple for worshipping beer

beer.beer_description: Do you remember when you dreamed of traveling to our cars with alternative fuels? ... Now with our Black IPA is possible ... Dark 200 octane!

items.badge_description: With a bitter bite and a toasted maltiness, this dark style is a perfect combination to be enjoyed any time, day or night. That's 50 different beers with the style of IPA - Black / Cascadian Dark Ale or IPA - Imperial / Double Black. Try 5 more for Level 11!

At first taste, dark ales can be overwhelming for even the most skilled of beer drinkers, but your will is weak and with time you will eventually turn to the dark side. That's 80 different beers with the style of Dark Ale, Belgian Strong Dark Ale, Lager - Dark, IPA - Black / Cascadian Dark Ale or IPA - Imperial / Double Black, Schwarzbier, or Mild - Dark. Try 5 more for Level 17!

Some may argue that wine is better than beer, especially in a country so well known for its vineyards. We all know they’re wrong. Cheers! That’s 35 different beers from a brewery in Italy. Try 5 more for Level 8.

Some may argue that wine is better than beer, especially in a country so well known for its vineyards. We all know they’re wrong. Cheers! That’s 5 beers from a brewery in Italy. Try 5 more for Level 2.

beer.beer_description:
Double Spaghetti Western 12th anniversary.
Revisiting the classic Spaghetti Western recipe for a decidedly strong end product.

items.badge_name: Beyond a Shadow of a Stout (Level 75)
items.badge_description: We all love Stouts, and now we have a dedicated badge to celebrate your dedication to these dark, top-fermented beer in multiple variations, like Oatmeal, Milk and more! Which one will you start with? That's 375 different beers with the style of Stout. Try 5 more for Level 76!

Some may argue that wine is better than beer, especially in a country so well known for its vineyards. We all know they’re wrong. Cheers! That’s 50 different beers from a brewery in Italy. Try 5 more for Level 11.

You don't always intend to go for beers with a double digit ABV, but when you do, you make it count! Cheers to you, but be careful, 10% and up can really pack a punch. That's 40 different beers with an ABV of 10% and up. Try 5 more for Level 9!

beer.beer_description:
West Coast style IPA with Citra, Columbus and Simcoe hops. Golden colored beer produced in the tradition of West Coast IPA. 
Amara, dry but very aromatic and well balanced by alcohol. 
The three varieties of hops used give a bouquet of aromas which stand in the exotic fruit and citrus.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 285 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 58!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 235 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 48!

Some may argue that wine is better than beer, especially in a country so well known for its vineyards. We all know they’re wrong. Cheers! That’s 5 beers from a brewery in Italy. Try 5 more for Level 2.

beer.beer_description: Chocolate Coffee Imperial Stout. Imperial Stout with added coffee and cocoa beans ripening in the cold prevail notes of roasted malts and coffee on the nose and in the mouth. Brewed in collaboration with Prairie Artisan Ales microbrewery in Oklahoma (USA).

items.badge_description: Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. That’s 10 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 3!

Some may argue that wine is better than beer, especially in a country so well known for its vineyards. We all know they’re wrong. Cheers! That’s 20 different beers from a brewery in Italy. Try 5 more for Level 5.

items.checkin_comment: WestCoast IPA od italskeho pivovaru Brewfist.7% alkoholu a hořkost 70 IBU.V ramci žánru poctive uvarena klasika.Pro chmelozrouty,kteří si potrpí na pořádnou dávku hořkosti je to návykové pití.

beer.beer_description:
West Coast style IPA with Citra, Columbus and Simcoe hops. Golden colored beer produced in the tradition of West Coast IPA. 
Amara, dry but very aromatic and well balanced by alcohol. 
The three varieties of hops used give a bouquet of aromas which stand in the exotic fruit and citrus.

items.badge_description: Load up those hops, watch the IBU grow and drink it down! Now you’re all hopped up. The more bitter, the better. That's 215 different beers with an IBU of 65 or higher. Try 5 more for Level 44!

beer.beer_description:
Il Montante, una doppelbock ai confini vista la gradazione bassa ma pienamente accettata per aroma e profumi. Schiuma da masticare dove i malti tostati hanno la meglio, la bevuta inizia in modo preciso con il caramello che sorprende quasi fosse un montante, il palato è già sazio quando arrivano i sentori di uva e luppolo Aurora a chiudere quello che potremmo chiamare un capolavoro senza dover per forza sembrare modesti. La birra che non ti aspetti da Brewfist solo perchè ti sei fatto un’idea sbagliata fino ad ora.

Plato: 17,0
Malti: Monaco, Pilsner
Luppoli: Aurora

Il Montante, una doppelbock ai confini vista la gradazione bassa ma pienamente accettata per aroma e profumi. Schiuma da masticare dove i malti tostati hanno la meglio, la bevuta inizia in modo preciso con il caramello che sorprende quasi fosse un montante, il palato è già sazio quando arrivano i sentori di uva e luppolo Aurora a chiudere quello che potremmo chiamare un capolavoro senza dover per forza sembrare modesti. Plato: 17,0
Malti: Monaco, Pilsner
Luppoli: Aurora
Sour fruit ale aged in barrel with peaches
Plum Baltic Porter, 24 Plato

items.badge_description: What happens when you take two or more amazing breweries, throw them into the tank and let them ferment together? An amazing collaboration beer, that’s what! Cheers to working together to create the perfect flavor. That's 155 different beers that have been brewed as a collaboration. Try 5 more for Level 32!

Strong, bold flavors really suit you. The barleywine brings with it a long history dating all the way back to ancient Greece. That's 10 different Barleywine, Wheat Wine Beers or Rye Wine! Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description:
West Coast style IPA with Citra, Columbus and Simcoe hops. Golden colored beer produced in the tradition of West Coast IPA. 
Amara, dry but very aromatic and well balanced by alcohol. 
The three varieties of hops used give a bouquet of aromas which stand in the exotic fruit and citrus.

items.badge_description: You've just tried one of three available styles from Style Hunt - Ale Trail!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 320 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 65!

items.checkin_comment: Light, and yet quite intense. Perfect for the afternoon tea.

beer.beer_description: The low alcohol ale and great drink. Designed for Brewfist pub "Terminal 1" and its regular thirsty customers, you can get everyone to agree, fans or not ... try it!

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 450 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 95 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 20.

Some may argue that wine is better than beer, especially in a country so well known for its vineyards. We all know they’re wrong. Cheers! That’s 160 different beers from a brewery in Italy. Try 5 more for Level 33.

beer.beer_description: Chocolate Coffee Imperial Stout. Imperial Stout with added coffee and cocoa beans ripening in the cold prevail notes of roasted malts and coffee on the nose and in the mouth. Brewed in collaboration with Prairie Artisan Ales microbrewery in Oklahoma (USA).

West Coast style IPA with Citra, Columbus and Simcoe hops. Golden colored beer produced in the tradition of West Coast IPA. 
Amara, dry but very aromatic and well balanced by alcohol. 
The three varieties of hops used give a bouquet of aromas which stand in the exotic fruit and citrus.

Imperial extremely hoppy IPA. The combination of American hops and oceanic perfectly hides the Alkohol. 
Once you realize that it will be 9% now ... 2Late! Serving temperature: 6-8 ° C

Imperial IPA brewed with Galaxy and Nelson Sauvin

Grape IPA.
- Here's lunar module Brewfist...you hear me? OVER 
- We hear you loud and clear! OVER 
- ask permission to return...L4103 operating protocol! OVER 
- This control tower base ground ...Brewfist permission granted! Over and out

This brief dialogue with the lunar module before the return of the Space Frontier...probably all it took was a simple "beer is ready, here we come!", But you already know that we like to do things in style! ;-) 

India Pale Ale in collaboration with To Øl from Denmark
Collaboration with the Danish brewery brew Beer Here. Brewed with rye malt and Columbus and Motueka hops Bitter, dry with a strong fruity aroma and resin
Do you remember when you dreamed of traveling to our cars with alternative fuels? ... Now with our Black IPA is possible ... Dark 200 octane!
The low alcohol ale and great drink. Designed for Brewfist pub "Terminal 1" and its regular thirsty customers, you can get everyone to agree, fans or not ... try it!

Imperial Porter intended to enter it in the bones ... A rich and complex beer that is brewed with a traditional English malts. Impenetrable dark color, well balanced with residual sugar of the bitter hops and alcohol important ... A big fat Porter!
IPA brewed with Amarillo and Cascade. In the mouth and nose prevail citrus and exotic fruits. The bitter end and make it a balanced beer for hop lovers ...
Milk Chocolate Stout. Dedicated to those who are afraid of the dark beers. Sweet, complex, but drinkable. The lactose and cocoa beans make it soft and scented. A beer for Foodies ...
Hoppy saison with Galaxy hops

Una lager vera, rivoluzionaria, dedicata alla passione per il ciclismo da sempre ben radicata nella nostra Bassa Padana. Dorata e brillante, profuma di miele, grano falciato e luppolo finemente speziato. Corpo pieno e lungo finale amaro. Consigliata prima, durante e dopo l’attività fisica.

Plato: 12,0
Malti: Pilsner, Monaco, Vienna
Luppoli: Hallertau Tradition
Gose with bergamot peel. Collaboration brew with DeMolen brewery

Walker Imperial Pils. On September 18, 2012 Chuck Norris, after a relaxing trip into space, he returned from a spacecraft into Earth's atmosphere diving, reaching a temperature of 3000 ° F. The impact swept Europe, leaving intact only a field of Saaz in the Czech Republic and Codogno to allow Brewfist and Pubs all'Arrogant to create this beautiful Pils.
A classic Spaceman with grapefruit peels.

Sour Wheat Beer, once an icon of the city of Berlin, home to the troubled 1936 olympics homaged in the label design. We add 100 kg of raspberries and 10 kg of basil to every batch: its vivid pink colour will seduce you, together with its rose, lemon and red fruits scent. It is light, sour and refreshing. We would call it a comfort beer.

Plato: 9,5
Malts: Pilsner, Wheat
Hops: Magnum
Special Ingredients: Raspberry, Basil

Hops: Centennial, Mosaic, Sterling

Malts: Munich, Pilsner

Beer of the Anglo-Saxon inspiration. deep red in color with notes caramelized and roasted accompanied by the aroma typical of English hops and a bitter finish and balanced ... ESB with Challenger, Bramling Cross and First Gold hops
Aged in Porto Barrels
A blend of different Spaghetti Western batches aged in Grappa Barriques for six months.

Il Montante, una doppelbock ai confini vista la gradazione bassa ma pienamente accettata per aroma e profumi. Schiuma da masticare dove i malti tostati hanno la meglio, la bevuta inizia in modo preciso con il caramello che sorprende quasi fosse un montante, il palato è già sazio quando arrivano i sentori di uva e luppolo Aurora a chiudere quello che potremmo chiamare un capolavoro senza dover per forza sembrare modesti. La birra che non ti aspetti da Brewfist solo perchè ti sei fatto un’idea sbagliata fino ad ora.

Plato: 17,0
Malti: Monaco, Pilsner
Luppoli: Aurora
Invecchiata un anno in botti di Pedro Ximenez

Ale made with English malts and German hops. Dry, with herbaceous aroma and slightly bitter aftertaste. A "session beer" to drink on all occasions ... 

Single hop Golden ale with Hallertau Saphir
Plum Baltic Porter, 24 Plato
